entry.title: Roseburg library celebrates 5 year anniversary
entry.summary: Roseburg Public Library is marking its five year anniversary with a community celebration on Saturday.

entry.title: Victoria is the first baby born in Douglas County in 2024
entry.summary: Brynn Lehnherr and Tim Purdue are the proud parents of the first baby born in Douglas County in 2024.

entry.title: Shop lost in Sunday fire
entry.summary: A shop and all of its contents were lost and a trailer sustained heat damage from a structure fire Sunday morning.

entry.title: W. Military Structure Fire (Photo)
entry.summary: At 04:06 am Sunday morning, 12/31/23, Douglas County Fire District No.2 responded to a reported possible structure fire on West Military Avenue in Roseburg. The first arriving fire crew reported a medium size shop that was fully involved with other structures threatened. A camp trailer parked nearby suffered minor heat damage, the shop and all its contents were a total loss. The cause of the fire is undetermined due to the extent of damage, but it’s believed the fire started from a possible electrical issue from a nearby chicken coop. DCFD No.2 responded with 3 fire engines, 1 water tender and 1 Command vehicle, Fire Crews were assisted by Lookingglass Fire department, DCSO, Roseburg PD, and PP&L.

entry.title: No matter the weather, get outside: YMCA opening indoor-outdoor recreation space
entry.summary: Oregon sees both ends of the weather spectrum — winter downpours and scorching summer heat — making it difficult to enjoy the outdoors.

entry.title: Roseburg Outlaw Kart races last weekend of 2023
entry.summary: The air was full of fumes, the building rumbled and the karts revved as racers from all over the West Coast gathered at the River Arena in the Douglas County Fairgrounds Complex in Roseburg.

entry.title: Forestland owners adapt to new forestry rules
entry.summary: Small forestland owners across the state find themselves in the midst of realizing that with 2024 approaching, changes will have to be made on their lands to comply with the new Private Forest Accord laws coming into effect Monday.

entry.title: Miss Oregon’s Teen readies for Miss America competition
entry.summary: While some students have spent winter break relaxing or spending time with family, Lena Larecy has spent her time preparing for Miss America’s Teen 2024.

entry.title: How to dispose of your Christmas tree
entry.summary: As the holiday season comes to a close, the time to dispose of your Christmas tree has arrived and several Douglas County companies are offering a helping hand.

entry.title: Happy Hogmanay, the Scottish way of ringing in the new year
entry.summary: Put a twist on your New Year’s Eve celebration with Hogmanay: the Scottish word for the last day of the year.

entry.title: National Alliance on Mental Illness meeting Monday
entry.summary: NAMI Douglas County, the local chapter of the National Alliance on Mental Illness, will hold its monthly meeting 6 p.m. Monday at the Vine Street Baptist Church, 2152 NE Vine St., Roseburg.

entry.title: Welch’s new book a delightful adventure
entry.summary: Readers searching for an inspirational, humorous, heartfelt book need look no further than Eugene writer Bob Welch’s latest title.
